Package tournament

Class Tournament

java.lang.Object
tournament.Tournament
public class Tournament extends Object
Defines a bracket-style tournament that can handle any number of players by making use of byes.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    private final ArrayList<Player>
    out
    ArrayList of Player objects representing all players who lost a Match and are out of the tournament.
    private final ArrayList<Player>
    players
    ArrayList of Player objects representing all players who are not out of the tournament.
    private final ArrayList<Match[]>
    rounds
    2-dimensional ArrayList of Match objects representing all matches in each round.

      public Tournament()

  • Method Details

    • addRound

      private void addRound(int byes)
      Add an empty array of Match objects to rounds with the appropriate number of bye matches and normal matches.

      This is a Match for each bye plus the ceiling division of half (the number of players - the number of byes).

      Parameters:
      byes - integer number of byes to include in the round.

    • addRound

      private void addRound()
      Add an array of Match objects to rounds with the appropriate number of matches based on the last round.

      This is half the number of matches is the last round.

    • addPlayer

      public void addPlayer(Player newPlayer)
      Adds a player to the tournament.
      Parameters:
      newPlayer - Player object

    • assignMatches

      public void assignMatches()
      Add a new round to rounds and assign all players to a Match in correspondence to the last round and the structure of a bracket tournament.

    • assignMatches

      public void assignMatches(int byes)
      Add a new round to rounds and assign all players to a Match in correspondence to their Elo rating.

      The top-rated players will receive a bye whilst the rest of the players will be paired together as: the highest rated player with the lowest rated player, the second-highest rated player with the second-lowest rated player, et ce tera.

      Parameters:
      byes - Number of byes to include in the round.

    • playMatches

      public void playMatches(int round)
      Simulate all matches in a given round.
      Parameters:
      round - Round number to simulate (starting at 0).

    • getNeededByes

      public int getNeededByes()
      Calculates the number of needed byes for the first round of a tournament based on how many players are in said tournament. Source: Tournament Byes
      Returns:
      integer number of byes needed.

    • getPlayers

      public ArrayList<Player> getPlayers()
      Getter for players.
      Returns:
      players

    • getNumberOfMatches

      public int getNumberOfMatches(int round)
      Gets number of matches in a given round.
      Parameters:
      round - The round to lookup (starts from 0).
      Returns:
      integer value representing the number of matches.

    • getLeaderboard

      public ArrayList<Player> getLeaderboard()
      Creates a leaderboard from the tournament based on number of wins.
      Returns:
      Sorted array of Player objects, the first element being the current first place player of the tournament and the last element being the last place player.
